column4: i just wanna figure out how i can set my xmms player to have a "add to playerlist" mode... i can do it manually using "xmms -e -Q" but i want to incorporate it into nautilus :(
hmm ubuntu comes with crappy mouse drivers
its not detecting my intellimouse sidebuttons :(
anyone know where i can find intellimouse driver support?
ooh awesome
you don't need driver support, just config to use thm
no.  nobody does.  And hardy questions are in #ubuntu+1
i've asked in there too ;__;
that's not really necessary.
sorry, heh
the best way to use backports is to not enable it as a repo
but I want other backport apps
flash is the only thing I dont want
Alright, well, if you must, pin flash to 9.0*
i do want flash updates though, just not through backports, there is no way to pin it to hardy recommended / security?
hardy[non-backports] will all be 9.0.*
please take that to #ubuntu-offtopic, thanks
https://help.ubuntu.com/community/NetworkManager#Automatic%20%20Keyring
See the section section regarding changing it
it just says /bash: /usr/lib/libpam-keyring/pam-keyring-tool: No such file or directory :(
shouldn't the keyring password be the users password by default? i think it would get really confusing for a user to change his/her password and the keyring password to not change as well
